00017     : fTime(timestamp), fData(samples), fChannel(channel){fmaxGauss = -1; fmaxbinGauss = -1; fchiSqrRed = -1;fPulseQuality = -1;}

00019   int GetTime() const { return fTime; }
00020   int GetNSamples() const { return fData.size(); }

00028   int GetMax(int first = 0) const { return GetMax(first,fData.size()-1); } //Make these two steps so you only need one implementation. Giving no argument just finds the maximum. Still, you can ask for the max between "first" and "last" sample
00029   int GetMax(int first, int last) const;
00030   int GetMaxBin(int first = 0) const { return GetMaxBin(first, fData.size()-1);}

00033   int GetMaxBinBlockTime(int first, int last) const;
00034

00036   double GetTimeNs() const; //Returns fTime in ns  This time is used in the event display
00037   
00038 
00039 
00040 
00041 //Added by Frederik, oct/nov 2011. Written in function of the Ge and NaI analysis, still can be used more general
00042 
00043   double GetAverageMax(int nAv, int first = 0) const { return GetAverageMax(nAv,first,fData.size()-1); } //First argument is number of point around the maximum you want to average "0" should give the same result as the GetMax method, "2" averages the maximum with the sample left and right of it, i.e. an average of 3 points 
00044   double GetAverageMax(int nAv, int first, int last) const;

00046   bool GoodPulse(int shapTime, double clockPeriod, int pedestal, int runnr, int level, int channel) ; // custom for weird overshoot samples of the Ge detector

00048   int GetCFBlockTime(int first, int last) const;

00050   int GetCFBin(int first, int last) const;

00052   double GetAverage(int first = 0) const {return GetAverage(first, fData.size()-1);}
00053   double GetAverage(int first,int last) const; //Give the average value between two boundaries. It is the user responsibility to make sure that "first" and "last" are ok. Use GetNSamples for that. The function will return -1 for arguments out of range
00054   double GetIntegral(int first = 0) const {return GetIntegral(first, fData.size()-1);}

00070   struct TimeSortFADCIslands {
00071     bool operator()(const TOctalFADCIsland& i1, const TOctalFADCIsland& i2) {
00072       int t1 = i1.GetTime();
00073       int t2 = i2.GetTime();
00074       return t1 < t2;
00075     }
00076   };
00077 
00078   struct TOctalFADCIslandTimeComparator {
00079     bool operator() (const TOctalFADCIsland& a, double time) {
00080       return a.GetTimeNs() < time;
00081     }
00082     bool operator() (double time,const TOctalFADCIsland& b) {
00083       return time < b.GetTimeNs();
00084     }
00085   };

00088   int fTime, fChannel;
00089   int fPulseQuality; // -1 is an unchecked pulse, 0 is an accepted pulse, 1,2,.... represent the level at  which the pulse/island is rejected
